content: I’m laughing now cause I was looking for Medium’s Trust and Safety people to ask them some questions when I ran into this… Medium’s bizarro world notion of “abuse” of their rules. Excerpt… I’ve been told by Medium’s “Trust and Safety” officer (sounds like something out of 1984) that I’m “abusing the system” by blocking annoying and unpleasant people, and that I should read the rules, even though he acknowledges that there’s no rule against blocking people … it would be bizarre to have both a blocking feature and a rule against using it. Apparently my transgression is to respond to the annoying or unpleasant comment before blocking the person. That’s what they call “abuse”. But how do they even become aware of this? Well, because the annoying and unpleasant people send complaints to Medium that I’m not allowing them to further be annoying and unpleasant toward me. But surely it is annoying the Medium staff with such complaints that is abusive. The notion that annoying and unpleasant people are entitled to get in one last jab before they are blocked is ludicrous.
